algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using a running difference to track required operations for each element.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an array can be made all zeros by repeatedly subtracting 1 from subarrays of size k.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a greedy strategy with a running count of active subtractions to check if each element can be reduced to zero by k-sized subarray operations.
key_insights: The key insight is that the order of operations on overlapping subarrays matters, but a greedy approach works.
We only need to track the net effect of operations ending at the current index.
If at any point an element needs to be reduced by more than what's currently available from previous operations, it's impossible.
